newsitem.title: ITALY: Specialists bid for 210 mln lire of Italy BTPs.
newsitem.headline: Specialists bid for 210 mln lire of Italy BTPs.

text.p: Specialist bond traders bid for and were allocated 195 million lire worth of three-year fixed rate bonds (BTPs) and 15 million lire of five-year BTPs against the Italian Treasury's offer of 350 billion lire and 250 billion lire worth of paper respectively.
Earlier, the Treasury received bids for 7.520 trillion lire at the open auction for the January 1, 2000 BTPs against 3.5 trillion lire worth of bonds on offer.
The auction price was set at 100.30 from 99.95 at the previous sale on January 2 and gross yield at 5.96 against 6.10 percent.
The Treasury received bids for 4.173 trillion lire for the January 1, 2002 BTPs against an offer of 2.5 trillion lire.
The auction price was set at 100.25 against 99.20 and gross yield at 6.28 from 6.54 percent.
